verses.verse: Who is this that cometh <S%H935><s%> from Edom <S%H123><s%>, with dyed <S%H2556><s%> garments <S%H899><s%> from Bozrah <S%H1224><s%>? this that is glorious <S%H1921><s%> in his apparel <S%H3830><s%>, travelling <S%H6808><s%> in the greatness <S%H7230><s%> of his strength <S%H3581><s%>? I that speak <S%H1696><s%> in righteousness <S%H6666><s%>, mighty <S%H7227><s%> to save <S%H3467><s%>.
Wherefore art thou red <S%H122><s%> in thine apparel <S%H3830><s%>, and thy garments <S%H899><s%> like him that treadeth <S%H1869><s%> in the winefat <S%H1660><s%>?

I have trodden <S%H1869><s%> the winepress <S%H6333><s%> alone; and of the people <S%H5971><s%> there was none <S%H376><s%> with me: for I will tread <S%H1869><s%> them in mine anger <S%H639><s%>, and trample <S%H7429><s%> them in my fury <S%H2534><s%>; and their blood <S%H5332><s%> shall be sprinkled <S%H5137><s%> upon my garments <S%H899><s%>, and I will stain <S%H1351><s%> all my raiment <S%H4403><s%>.
For the day <S%H3117><s%> of vengeance <S%H5359><s%> is in mine heart <S%H3820><s%>, and the year <S%H8141><s%> of my redeemed <S%H1350><s%> is come <S%H935><s%>.

And I looked <S%H5027><s%>, and there was none to help <S%H5826><s%>; and I wondered <S%H8074><s%> that there was none to uphold <S%H5564><s%>: therefore mine own arm <S%H2220><s%> brought salvation <S%H3467><s%> unto me; and my fury <S%H2534><s%>, it upheld <S%H5564><s%> me.

And I will tread down <S%H947><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> in mine anger <S%H639><s%>, and make them drunk <S%H7937><s%> in my fury <S%H2534><s%>, and I will bring down <S%H3381><s%> their strength <S%H5332><s%> to the earth <S%H776><s%>.

¶ I will mention <S%H2142><s%> the lovingkindnesses <S%H2617><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, and the praises <S%H8416><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, according to all that the LORD <S%H3068><s%> hath bestowed <S%H1580><s%> on us, and the great <S%H7227><s%> goodness <S%H2898><s%> toward the house <S%H1004><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, which he hath bestowed <S%H1580><s%> on them according to his mercies <S%H7356><s%>, and according to the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of his lovingkindnesses <S%H2617><s%>.
For he said <S%H559><s%>, Surely they are my people <S%H5971><s%>, children <S%H1121><s%> that will not lie <S%H8266><s%>: so he was their Saviour <S%H3467><s%>.

In all their affliction <S%H6869><s%> he was afflicted <S%H6862><s%>, and the angel <S%H4397><s%> of his presence <S%H6440><s%> saved <S%H3467><s%> them: in his love <S%H160><s%> and in his pity <S%H2551><s%> he redeemed <S%H1350><s%> them; and he bare <S%H5190><s%> them, and carried <S%H5375><s%> them all the days <S%H3117><s%> of old <S%H5769><s%>.

¶ But they rebelled <S%H4784><s%>, and vexed <S%H6087><s%> his holy <S%H6944><s%> Spirit <S%H7307><s%>: therefore he was turned <S%H2015><s%> to be their enemy <S%H341><s%>, and he fought <S%H3898><s%> against them.

Then he remembered <S%H2142><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of old <S%H5769><s%>, Moses <S%H4872><s%>, and his people <S%H5971><s%>, saying, Where is he that brought them up <S%H5927><s%> out of the sea <S%H3220><s%> with the shepherd <S%H7462><s%> of his flock <S%H6629><s%>? where is he that put <S%H7760><s%> his holy <S%H6944><s%> Spirit <S%H7307><s%> within <S%H7130><s%> him?

That led <S%H3212><s%> them by the right hand <S%H3225><s%> of Moses <S%H4872><s%> with his glorious <S%H8597><s%> arm <S%H2220><s%>, dividing <S%H1234><s%> the water <S%H4325><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> them, to make <S%H6213><s%> himself an everlasting <S%H5769><s%> name <S%H8034><s%>?
That led <S%H3212><s%> them through the deep <S%H8415><s%>, as an horse <S%H5483><s%> in the wilderness <S%H4057><s%>, that they should not stumble <S%H3782><s%>?

As a beast <S%H929><s%> goeth down <S%H3381><s%> into the valley <S%H1237><s%>, the Spirit <S%H7307><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> caused him to rest <S%H5117><s%>: so didst thou lead <S%H5090><s%> thy people <S%H5971><s%>, to make <S%H6213><s%> thyself a glorious <S%H8597><s%> name <S%H8034><s%>.

¶ Look down <S%H5027><s%> from heaven <S%H8064><s%>, and behold <S%H7200><s%> from the habitation <S%H2073><s%> of thy holiness <S%H6944><s%> and of thy glory <S%H8597><s%>: where is thy zeal <S%H7068><s%> and thy strength <S%H1369><s%>, the sounding <S%H1995><s%> of thy bowels <S%H4578><s%> and of thy mercies <S%H7356><s%> toward me? are they restrained <S%H662><s%>?

Doubtless <S%H3588><s%> thou art our father <S%H1><s%>, though Abraham <S%H85><s%> be ignorant <S%H3808><s%> <S%H3045><s%> of us, and Israel <S%H3478><s%> acknowledge <S%H5234><s%> us not: thou, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, art our father <S%H1><s%>, our redeemer <S%H1350><s%>; thy name <S%H8034><s%> is from everlasting <S%H5769><s%>.

¶ O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, why hast thou made us to err <S%H8582><s%> from thy ways <S%H1870><s%>, and hardened <S%H7188><s%> our heart <S%H3820><s%> from thy fear <S%H3374><s%>? Return <S%H7725><s%> for thy servants' <S%H5650><s%> sake, the tribes <S%H7626><s%> of thine inheritance <S%H5159><s%>.

The people <S%H5971><s%> of thy holiness <S%H6944><s%> have possessed <S%H3423><s%> it but a little while <S%H4705><s%>: our adversaries <S%H6862><s%> have trodden down <S%H947><s%> thy sanctuary <S%H4720><s%>.
We are thine: thou never <S%H5769><s%> barest rule <S%H4910><s%> over them; they were not called <S%H7121><s%> by thy name <S%H8034><s%>.
